TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit LogRecord extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: Represents a log record that has been appended to a sequence.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
When overridden in a derived class, gets a stream that contains the record data.
Docs.value: A stream that contains the record data.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose() cil managed

Docs.summary: Releases all resources used by the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks You should call this method when you finish using the <xref:System.IO.Log.LogRecord> instance. The <xref:System.IO.Log.LogRecord.Dispose%2A> method leaves the <xref:System.IO.Log.LogRecord> instance in an unusable state. After calling this method, you must release all references to the <xref:System.IO.Log.LogRecord> instance, so that the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the <xref:System.IO.Log.LogRecord> instance was occupying.
> [!NOTE] > Always call <xref:System.IO.Log.LogRecord.Dispose%2A> before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.IO.Log.LogRecord> instance. Otherwise, the resources it is using cannot be freed until the garbage collector calls the <xref:System.IO.Log.LogRecord> instance's `Finalize` method.

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the sequence number of the previous record.
Docs.value: The sequence number of the previous record.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value of this property is the sequence number that was provided as the `previousUndoRecord` parameter in the <xref:System.IO.Log.IRecordSequence.Append%2A> method. Aside from its use in enumeration, this sequence number is treated as opaque by the record sequence.

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the sequence number of this record.
Docs.value: The sequence number of this record.

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the sequence number of the next record.
Docs.value: The sequence number of the next record in the user-specified chain.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value of this property is the sequence number that was provided as the `nextUndoRecord` parameter in the <xref:System.IO.Log.IRecordSequence.Append%2A> method. Aside from its use in enumeration, this sequence number is treated as opaque by the record sequence.
